thread.title: Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge with 5-inch HD display and 16GB storage launched in the US
thread.title_full: Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge with 5-inch HD display and 16GB storage launched in the US

title: Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge with 5-inch HD display and 16GB storage launched in the US
text:
Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge with 5-inch HD display and 16GB storage launched... Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge with 5-inch HD display and 16GB storage launched in the US By -   Galaxy J3 Emerge is the US-exclusive variant of the yet to be announced Galaxy J3 2017‚Äù 
As expected, Samsung has quietly added a new budget smartphone to its Galaxy J series with the launch of the Galaxy J3 Emerge. It is the US-exclusive variant of the yet to be announced Galaxy J3 2017. It is currently available for the subscribers of Sprint, Boost, and Virgin Mobile telecom operators. 
The Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge features a 5-inch HD display, and boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow. The phone is powered by a Qualcomm Snapdragon 430 processor, mated to 1.5GB of RAM. It comes with 16GB of internal memory, further expandable up to 256GB by inserting a microSD card. The camera department includes a 5MP rear snapper with f/1.9 aperture and an LED flash, and a 2MP selfie shooter. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.2, and A-GPS. A 2,600mAh battery keeps the whole package alive. 
The Samsung Galaxy J3 Emerge has been priced at $234.99, which roughly translates to Rs 16,000. The phone is expected to be launched in global markets as the Galaxy J3 2017 in the coming weeks.
